I have try this demoI with the latest agent , and I can't reproduce this issue. 

I had add an Controller to call `demoService.process` method and Here is the sample data:
```

- applicationCode: test-demo
  segmentSize: 1
  segments:

      operationId: 0
      parentSpanId: -1

      spanLayer: Http
      startTime: 1537757193560
      endTime: 1537757193676
      componentId: 14
      componentName: ''
      isError: false
      spanType: Entry
      peer: ''
      peerId: 0
      tags:

      - {key: http.method, value: GET}
```

# Report @ 2018/08/26 the prefix description of Issue: |prefix|description| |:---|:---| |**[AGENT]** | This prefix represent that this issue is an agent issue| |**[COLLECTOR]**| This prefix represent that this issue is a collector issue| |**[UI]**| This prefix represent that this issue is an UI issue| |**[UNKNOWN]**| This prefix represent that everyone should pay attention to this issue| |**[APP_STANDBY]**| This prefix represent that this issue happened after server started| |**[APP_SERVICE_PROVIDED]**|This prefix represent that this issue happened after call service| ## Issue ### Application ~~* **[UI]** There are some error in topology page, and the page is blank.~~ Here is the screen snapshot: error log: ``` 2.2c6e0b89.async.js:1 Can not apply layout: No such layout `s` found; did you include its JS file? cause by org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.ContextManager.continued(ContextManager.java:150)
and check snapshot isFromCurrent error
why check error, is my code error ?
I am not following. Which one is right? The log shows capture. Capture is impossible caused by continued.

Wow!! This is a very big forward step for SkyWalking. @peng-yongsheng @hanahmily @liuhaoyang @ascrutae I invite all of you into this ticket. Let's find out which source and what kind of protocol we can provide for the browser side.

This fits version6 design core very much. We finally meet the extension at Browser.

The first step, we need to design the **source** and **gRPC service** for browser side. @kkroy-zs Do you have something in mind about which services backend provided to receive your metric? That relates to which kinds of data you could uplink in single one request, and which kinds of data should be in a group? I am looking forward to your proposal and idea.
FYI @liuhaoyang @terrymanu @terrymanu You may begin to think about database **Source** and **Metric Service** too. Count on you.
I have reservations about using gRPC in javascript. We have done this before, but we have encountered compatibility problems with gRPC. In our practice, the performance of http  is enough.

For backend performance, read our document to get some idea
1. Our backend analysis based on OAL, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/concepts-and-designs/oal.md @kkroy-zs It is easy to understand, I think.
1. For the browser side, I recommend you to read the scope definition doc, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/concepts-and-designs/scope-definitions.md . We need to define the browser scopes first.

> I have reservations about using gRPC in javascript. We have done this before, but we have encountered compatibility issues with gRPC. In our practice, the performance of http is enough.

@liuhaoyang Sorry, I don't mean using gRPC as service. I am OK with HTTP, and think it is good enough too.

OK, get that. So if you don't have the context in the new thread, how to continue? **Continued** means, current context continues from the Snapshot. So you could see the current context should be existed always.

> FYI @liuhaoyang @terrymanu @terrymanu You may begin to think about database **Source** and **Metric Service** too. Count on you.

@wu-sheng Yes, it is really good metric list. I will tell our DBA team to evaluate soon.

OK,  I wrote below codes at the beginning. like asynchttpclient plugin
```
 ContextManager.createLocalSpan("netty-http-client/local");

ContextManager.continued(contextSnapshot);
```
but the result is not my expect
i will try it again

> OK, I wrote below codes at the beginning. like asynchttpclient plugin

That codes look good to me. Should work. If not, consider affected by other things.
@liuhaoyang Do you have any metric suggestion? I have known you have some experiences about this.
I had tested and I think the code is ready for release.

OK, it works! another question is i found localspan (netty-http-client/send-request) is display in traces list , the localspan(netty-http-client/send-request) and entryspan(/api/ping) have same trace id, i don't know is it correct?
If so, those are in the same thread. Please be sure what do your codes suppose to do. You have read the codes, if they are in same thread, capture/continue will not work, even you called.

``` My codes logic looks like: UserRequest | /|\ | | \|/ | NettyServerIOThread | /|\ createEntrySpan | | stopEntrySpan (/api/ping) | | | | captureSnapshot | | \|/ | NettyClientIOThread | /|\ createLocalSpan | | stopLocalSpan (netty-http-client/send-request) | | | | continuedSnapshot | | | | createExitSpan | | stopExitSpan (/api/ping) | | \|/ | Ping/PongService ``` > 1. createEntrySpan(/api/ping) , captureSnapshot, stopEntrySpan in a thread. > 2. createLocalSpan(netty-http-client/send-request), continuedSnapshot, createExitSpan(/api/ping), stopExitSpan, stopLocalSpan in another thread. I think the continuedSnapshot is worked the below png is after comment `ContextManager.continued(contextSnapshot);` the localspan(netty-http-client/send-request) and entryspan(/api/ping) have different trace id, maybe i describe not correct, they are not called `localspan(netty-http-client/send-request)`,`entryspan(/api/ping)` in trace list and trace is not complete, only one span, it looks like
OK. Thanks, I will begin the release process.
If Trace IDs are not the same, it means, `continued` doesn't work as expected. See `TracingContext#continued`. The `this.segment.relatedGlobalTraces` in that method shows you how continue works.

https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/issues/1707#issuecomment-424933082  is comment code `ContextManager.continued(contextSnapshot); `

https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/issues/1707#issuecomment-424917742 is uncomment code `ContextManager.continued(contextSnapshot); `
in this case,  Trace IDs are the same,  but localspan is dispaly in traces list, I don't know if that's correct?

> in this case, Trace IDs are the same, but localspan is dispaly in traces list, I don't know if that's correct?

Ah, I think I get your point this time. The list showing there is trace segment list, not trace. So, if a trace across two threads, two segments are expected. The simple answer is YES, that is correct.

> For backend performance, read our document to get some idea
> 
> 1. Our backend analysis based on OAL, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/concepts-and-designs/oal.md @kkroy-zs It is easy to understand, I think.
> 2. For the browser side, I recommend you to read the scope definition doc, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/concepts-and-designs/scope-definitions.md . We need to define the browser scopes first.

@wu-sheng OK, I'll read it first to build up the imaginations of the services.
Otherwise, Due to the datas' structrue, there also have some statistics-dimensions which is base on the acquired web-datas must be considered. When I washed out the metric of statistics-dimensions, I will post it here too.
Wow, it just looks error, now i compiled successfully, thanks!

> 
> 
> The easy answer is **YES, you can**.
> 
> But you should be aware of these:
> 
>     1. Follow this document(assume you need cn version) : [link](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/cn/Deploy-skywalking-agent-CN.md#%E9%AB%98%E7%BA%A7%E7%89%B9%E6%80%A7) . You can use `-Dskywalking.*` to override any config in file as you wish.
> 
>     2. When two application use the same agent folder, by default, your logs output into the same file. This is hard to read and understand, but these is a bug in this version(3.2.6) to override it. I already try to fix it, see #697.
> 
> 
> So, that is why I just recommend use separated agent jars. OK?
> 
> BTW, I just change the issue title.
> 
> Hope these can help you.

```yaml

cluster:
  standalone:
#  zookeeper:
#    hostPort: localhost:2181
#    # Retry Policy
#    baseSleepTimeMs: 1000 # initial amount of time to wait between retries
#    maxRetries: 3 # max number of times to retry
#  kubernetes:
#    watchTimeoutSeconds: 60
#    namespace: default
#    labelSelector: app=collector,release=skywalking
#    uidEnvName: SKYWALKING_COLLECTOR_UID
core:
  default:
    restHost: 0.0.0.0
    restPort: 12800
    restContextPath: /
    gRPCHost: 0.0.0.0
    gRPCPort: 11800
storage:
  elasticsearch:
    clusterNodes: localhost:9200
    indexShardsNumber: 2
    indexReplicasNumber: 0
    # Batch process setting, refer to https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/java-api/5.5/java-docs-bulk-processor.html
    bulkActions: 2000 # Execute the bulk every 2000 requests
    bulkSize: 20 # flush the bulk every 20mb
    flushInterval: 10 # flush the bulk every 10 seconds whatever the number of requests
    concurrentRequests: 2 # the number of concurrent requests
    # Set a timeout on metric data. After the timeout has expired, the metric data will automatically be deleted.
    traceDataTTL: 90 # Unit is minute
    minuteMetricDataTTL: 90 # Unit is minute
    hourMetricDataTTL: 36 # Unit is hour
    dayMetricDataTTL: 45 # Unit is day
    monthMetricDataTTL: 18 # Unit is month
receiver-register:
  default:
receiver-trace:
  default:
    bufferPath: ../buffer/  # Path to trace buffer files, suggest to use absolute path
    bufferOffsetMaxFileSize: 100 # Unit is MB
    bufferDataMaxFileSize: 500 # Unit is MB
    bufferFileCleanWhenRestart: false
receiver-jvm:
  default:
service-mesh:
  default:
    bufferPath: ../buffermesh/  # Path to trace buffer files, suggest to use absolute path
    bufferOffsetMaxFileSize: 100 # Unit is MB
    bufferDataMaxFileSize: 500 # Unit is MB
    bufferFileCleanWhenRestart: false
istio-telemetry:
  default:
query:
  graphql:
    path: /graphql
alarm:
  default:

```

All metric name should be in lower case. The generation tool causes that.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/19223548/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/19223548)

Coverage decreased (-0.003%) to 14.379% when pulling **f96a0d7e8d887c75c79813d4649e605c42625e83 on fix/alarm-query-mock** into **2f43cb940eb4308a739c3392f04533b3e73e6345 on master**.

Great work! In my own opinion, @kkroy-zs 's work is going to open up a new and important area for skywalking.
I have to say the data of the webpage is much more complicated than backend. The resource request, such as ajax request, is similar to backend service and could be easily handled by oap-server. But the page performance data, such as page loading time, is a very new world for skywallking. We should make some major changes to receive such data.

Submit this PR https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1714 @hanahmily Could you try to run a test on this? This should fix the `numberOfEndpoint` not right. And remember to clear all existing data in ElasticSearch.
